plugin.name: depclean-maven-plugin
plugin.description: DepClean is a plugin for automatically remove unused dependencies in Maven projects

mojo.description: This Maven mojo produces a clean copy of the project's pom file without bloated dependencies. It is built on top of the maven-dependency-analyzer component.

parameter.name: createPomDebloated
parameter.description: If this is true, DepClean creates a debloated version of the pom without unused dependencies, called 'debloated-pom.xml', in root of the project.

parameter.name: failIfUnusedDependency
parameter.description: If this is true, and DepClean reported any unused dependency in the dependency tree, the build fails immediately after running DepClean.

parameter.name: ignoreDependencies
parameter.description: Add a list of dependencies, identified by their coordinates, to be ignored by DepClean during the analysis and considered as used dependencies. Useful to override incomplete result caused by bytecode-level analysis Dependency format is groupId:artifactId:version.
